title: Diveagar Beach
subtitle: Golden sands, serene shores, and hidden coastal charm
overview: Diveagar Beach is a quiet and clean beach located in the Raigad district of Maharashtra, known for its pristine shoreline and tranquil atmosphere.
It stretches for about 6 kilometers and is surrounded by coconut and betel nut plantations, making it a perfect weekend escape.
The beach is also known for its historic Suvarna Ganesh temple and untouched natural beauty.

highlights.title: Secluded Beach
highlights.description: Long stretch of clean beach, perfect for solitude and nature lovers.

highlights.title: Coconut Groves
highlights.description: Lush plantations around the beach offer shade and scenic charm.

highlights.title: Suvarna Ganesh Temple
highlights.description: Famous for its once-hidden golden idol, now a spiritual hub.

highlights.title: Gentle Waves
highlights.description: Safe waters ideal for swimming and playing by the shore.

geography.intro: Diveagar Beach lies on the Konkan coast, about 170 km from Pune and 190 km from Mumbai, in the Shrivardhan Taluka of Raigad district.

details.label: Flora
details.value: Coconut palms, betel nut trees, and rice fields

climate.description: Diveagar enjoys a coastal tropical climate with humid summers, lush monsoons, and pleasant winters. Ideal time to visit is October to March.

geography.conclusion: The beachâ€™s gentle slope, safe waters, and natural surroundings make it perfect for families and nature seekers.

activities.title: Beach Walks
activities.description: Stroll along the serene coastline under swaying palm trees.
info: Early morning or sunset is most peaceful

activities.title: Visit Suvarna Ganesh Temple
activities.description: Pay homage at the iconic temple famous for its golden Ganesh idol history.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture birds, landscapes, and village life near the coast.

attractions.title: Suvarna Ganesh Temple
attractions.description: Spiritual and historical landmark famous for once housing a golden idol.

attractions.title: Harihareshwar
attractions.description: A scenic temple town about 35 km away, known for its coastal temples and sacred beach.

attractions.title: Shrivardhan Beach
attractions.description: Popular nearby beach known for water sports and seafood shacks.

marineLife.intro: Diveagar Beach supports a modest but vibrant coastal ecosystem with migratory birds, shellfish, and tidal organisms.

items.title: Coastal Fish
items.description: Small fish and aquatic life are often seen near shallow waters and rocks.

items.title: Bird Watching
items.description: Spot egrets, kingfishers, and seagulls along the shore.

items.title: Coastal Flora
items.description: Coconut palms and native grass species line the beachfront.

conclusion: Diveagar promotes sustainable coastal living with low-impact tourism.
The balance of nature and village charm supports a rich yet peaceful ecosystem.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest Airport: Pune (170 km), Mumbai (190 km)
Taxis or buses available from both cities

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest Station: Mangaon on Konkan Railway
From there, cabs/buses to Diveagar (40 km)

howToReach.title: By Road
details: From Mumbai via NH66 to Mangaon then state roads
From Pune via Tamhini Ghat route

bookingTips.description: Book 2 weeks ahead during long weekends
Bring own vehicle for local travel ease
